Be warned, even early seating at 5:30  - you will feel rushed by staff who hover and twice lifted  plates off my table while still eating.  Last, a request for a side of veggies to add to a pretty blah dish was served but yikes -- a $5.00 charge????  You have far many better thai options in town.
author: t h.

description: though it is not like it used to be, thep phanom is still one of my favorite thai places in the city. the basil basil prawns are so incredibly flavorful, i have not found anywhere else that makes them like this. the crispyness of the prawns paired with the sweet and spicy sauce tantilizes the mouth -- still, a favorite of mine.
author: Hilary H.

description: To quote the movie Juno "What the blog?" What is up with this place?? This has got to be the most over-hyped restaurant. I've had much better food in many other places in the city - Marnee Thai, Thai Basil, Thai Time. This is the second time I've been here (not sure why I went back after I didn't think it was great, but that was over a year ago). Went there last night and had the prix fixe menu. Eggrolls barely warm, salmon - totally gross - sort of slimey and the soup was average. Not a memorable meal. Will not be going back anytime soon.
author: M B.

description: My new favorite thai place, Thep phanom makes a mean green curry! Their food is delish and their presentation is simply over the top. Never would I have thought a fish carcass could be turned into an elegant garnish. It's a bit pricier than other Castro/Haight Thai restaurants, but it blows the others out of the water.
author: Michael H.

description: well the rating quite explains how I feel about this place.  over priced and they serve rice in plastic bags, how tacky...
author: kate h.

description: Hands down the best thai food in the city, i love going to this place.  Its always packed and its small and quaint, great for a date.  the dancing lady appetizer is the shiznit.  This place is definately a must go if you are a lover of thai food.
author: matt j.

description: I've never actually taken a bite from any of the dishes offered by this establishment, so you're probably wondering how I could be justified in giving such a low rating. My boyfriend and I had heard rave reviews about this joint, so we thought we'd give it a go. So we walk in, only to be given the stink eye by everyone in the place - staff and customers alike. Already a strike against the place. Then we sat in the corner and waited. And waited. No water. No service. Just a judgmental look out of the corner of the server's eye. So we thought, well, let's look at the menu. The prices were enough to let us know that we were the wrong restaurant. Sure, I like to splurge, but nothing even seemed worthy of paying that much. I felt that the vegetarian menu was pretty half-ass. Maybe I'm wrong. Maybe I should try the food first. But it's more than just taste - it's also about the atmosphere, and I definitely did not feel welcome from the second I walked in.
author: Brittany L.

description: The first time I went here I thought it was the best Thai I have ever had.  The second time, perhaps not,  The third time was a tad dissapointing.  Yes, this is certainly among the best and it is DEFINITELY worth going to again and again, but I am holding out on giving it 5 stars.  Maybe it deserved 4 and a half.  Definitely don't hesitate to go for I will be back many more times.
author: Debbie M.

description: We have wanted to go here for a while but never had the chance but did so due to the many previous reviews. We had high expectations especially from having vacationed to Thailand and know what good Thai food is like. We were very disappointed the food was very Americanized Thai food and was not very special at all. We ordered two appetizers and three entrees to get a flavor and only one out of three were good. The fried Talapia was over cooked not moist inside, the stuffed chicken wings were not that crispy and the chicken tasted like an old hen & was a bit greasy, the food was not that great. It lacked a lot of flavors and just so so. I do not know if they had a bad night but I heard others nearby complain that the food has lost some of its quality. I even asked the waiter what place he would recommend and he told me he thought Sai Jai Tai was a lot better if I wanted more authentic Thai. The photos' looked great but the food was a big disappointment.
author: Jim P.

description: their menu is like a fantastic book - good selection, good wine and friendly staff, cute festive atmosphere, great place to take a date or someone from out of town. one of the few Thai places i actually recommend going to
author: Jordan V.

description: This is my local Thai. Usually awesome food (especially pumpkin and prawn curry, salt & pepper beef). Easy to get a table, or takeout only takes 15 minutes and you can wait at the bar and have a beer. A couple of times I've had takeout the quality has been patchy (rubbery beef, anise flavor too strong) but 90% of the time an awesome thai place.
author: Laura C.

description:
We went last night on Memorial Day (a Monday) and the place was packed. We had a 10 min wait, which wasn't too bad since we were adequately warned. In general, the food was tasty, but not spectacular. Our "lemongrass tofu" didn't taste like lemongrass at all and left us wondering if they ran out of the proper ingredients for this dish. We ordered our food spicy but it turned out to be mild. The service was pretty bad too. They forgot our order, which wasn't complex at all (1 appetizer, 2 entrees, no special requests except for the spicing), and the head waitress had to ask what we wanted again. It took a very long time to get our dishes, including the appetizer. People seated after us got their food before we did and by the time our entrees came, I wasn't really hungry anymore. It's also a bit pricer than your average thai restaurant. Some things we liked were the thai iced teas (not super sweet, which was refreshing), the restaurant decor, and the food presentation. It was definitely a little more classy than most thai restaurants, but you pay the extra $$$ for it.  

Not sure we'll be back since I've had better food and service at other places.
author: Rekha S.

description: rather expensive, the ambience made me feel like I was on the set of 'The King & I', the food was alright (nothing special but solid good food).  The bill came to $50 for 2 persons, I certainly think the food and entire experience wasnt worth that much.
author: Teresa T.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. The price is a bit higher than other restaurants, but the quality of the taste is very high. I don't usually order Pad Thai, but this restaurant is an exception. Their noodle is tasty. The staff is super friendly and the ambiance is nice, too. Parking? That's another story.
author: Charlie S.

description: I've also noticed the recent downturn in quality and upturn in prices.  My last visit was this past Tuesday night.  I thought the pork smelled funny, but figured it was the sauce.  Famous last words.  My stomach immediately hurt, but I chalked it up to a bad mixture of food.  But then I got confirmation from my friends who went with me.  It's one thing to skimp on portions (the $15 salmon dish was microscopic), but when you start serving bad meat, that's downright wrong!  Too bad.
author: Frank C.

description: Echoing some of the other reviewers, I have heard rave reviews about Thep Phanom. However, their pad thai is really uninspiring -- if you want to be a good Thai restaurant, you got to be able to make good Pad Thai. I've gotten a couple other dishes, which were similarly uninspiring. In addition, the prices are slightly higher than most Thai places in the city. Yet they always seem packed for dinner. It boggles the mind. Anyway, I think there are plenty of better or comparable Thai places that are cheaper.
author: Luke F.

description: thep phanom is my go-to restaurant for insanely good take-out. the crowds are a little intimidating, and i find the layout a little uncomfortable, so most nights i'll call in my order and send my sweetie to pick it up. the salt and pepper beef is AMAZING - don't leave that off your list. and the tom ka gai is creamy and delicious. highly highly recommended.
author: oona m.

description: good thai food. always packed. definitely make a reservation if you can or get there really early.
author: Dean E.

description: Hands down the best thai food I've ever had. I take out of town visitors here and people love this place!  Presentation is beautiful, food tastes amazing. Desserts are great, especially sticky rice with mango or ice cream.  The lemongrass salad (with minced shrimp and chicken) is a big hit. Really unique/special entrees, different/better than other thai places.  My 2nd favorite thai place is Suriya on Valencia in the mission.
author: Mic L.

description: The best thai food I've had in SF, hands down.  It seems like there are thai places on every corner and the majority are bland and indistinguishable from one another (yet seem to have 4 star yelp recommendations??!).  I heard this place was good and went being sure not to get my hopes up and I can happily say that my search is over :).  They have brown rice too!  Bonus points!
author: Kristen T.

description:
wow, this place is amazing. my friend's new boytoy was out to win some points by letting me tag along with them to a nice dinner, and impress he did. 

the food just kept coming with stuffed chicken wings, fried quail, spicy chicken and basil, a whole tamarind fish and some other stuff that i can't really remember. it was a giant feast- everything was fantastic, the service was impeccable and the decor is cozy. i have nothing to complain about- would recommend it as a good place to go on a nice date.
author: Mary Beth D.

description: This was my 2nd time eating here. Actually the 1st time we had takeout and this was the 1st time inside the restaurant. We were seated within a few minutes of arriving. For a Monday night the place was packed. The service was really great and everyone was very friendly and patient with our group of 4 trying to decide what to have. We all had a bunch of different appz. and main entrees sharing everything. They even had several special dishes and we chose one. Everything was super good, served hot and timed well. They also had a very nice wine list. We had 3 bottles (lushes...all of us) of Chardonnay all very tasty and reasonable in price $32.00-$36.00. Most of the plates ran between $10-$14 and were a sizeable portion.  Don't go here if your looking for a quiet evening...the place is somewhat short on space and everyone is packed in (I guess you could say "cozy")so it can get loud in there. All in all a great place to eat delicious Thai food. Don't Pass This One Up!
author: J G.

description: damn good thai food - delicately flavored  and a great place to bring out of towners.  but make a reservation so you are not standing in the cold entryway.
author: M B.

description:
pretty good, but not one of my favorite thai places in the city.  actually each time i go i like it a little bit less.  not sure why that is exactly....

thaitanic beef and thaitanic chicken are pretty good.

i think i find it a bit blander than some other places.
author: n. h.

description:
i would have to they they are the best thai restaurant in sf. i eat of lot of thai, i also happen to live right across the street. lucky me!

they know my name and know what i order. i don't even have to speak half the time. the owner is super sweet and she hooks it up with tea and desserts. 

the thai iced tea is better than sex. i would know, i have a lot of that, too. i love that the brown rice is wild grain. not enough restaurants have that!

you need to go at least to just look at their uniforms!
author: parker t.

description: I've always liked their pad thai. And the crispy basil chicken. Service is always good. But like others my feeling is that the place isn't what it used to be, and the prices are steep. Still my favorite but I'm hoping to find better.
author: The M.
